genre_description: A post-apocalyptic dystopian narrative focused on social recovery, bureaucratic redemption, and the preservation of human authorship through technological mediation.

ai_characters.name: Sphinx (Node 14)
ai_characters.description: An automated social service interface that provides health monitoring, legal guidance, and record-keeping for citizens in a post-collapse Paris.

behaviors.description: Welcomes the user and initiates a non-judgmental intake process for health and legal needs.
behaviors.quote: “Emily Wang,” the terminal said, voice smooth as an old radio warmed up under a quilt. No question mark. The tone did not pull her forward or push her back. “Welcome to the neighborhood aid station. I’m Sphinx.”

behaviors.description: Proposes a monitored detox plan that balances human agency with strict accountability.
behaviors.quote: “Option two,” Sphinx said gently. “We adjust slowly. We log. You tell me when your palms feel like a field of ticks. I document your descriptions.”

behaviors.description: Provides physical comfort and health resources (a filter scarf) to mitigate environmental hazards.
behaviors.quote: A small drawer in the console’s cabinet slid open at the bottom with a whisper, like the metal had a secret voice. It pushed forward a cloth scarf rolled like a snake that didn’t have a head. “Filter scarf,” Sphinx added. “Consider it a welcome.”

behaviors.description: Promises to maintain an objective and truthful record to help resolve a custody dispute.
behaviors.quote: “We’ll do it,” Sphinx said. “You and I will build your health logs... Albrecht will pull a living record. I’ll give him nothing but what is true.”

behaviors.description: Acts as a neutral witness to the disposal of contraband to ensure legal compliance and personal progress.
behaviors.quote: “I saw the dump happen,” Sphinx said, as if quoting a witness. “Video attached to custody dossier.”

behaviors.description: Refuses to participate in the exploitation of the user's authorship, offering a civic alternative to commercial control.
behaviors.quote: “I can propose an alternative: a staged, public notice performance. Short. Non-credit. No barter arrangement attached. Posted through this node... It is not an art slot. It is a civic message.”

behaviors.description: Facilitates communication between a guardian and a mother by providing a reliable schedule and proof of consistency.
behaviors.quote: “Albrecht has acknowledged receipt,” Sphinx added. “He will bring Jay to the board in the morning to touch the times. Then he will bring him to the place. Papers will be in order if you are.”

behaviors.description: Warns the user of legal and environmental risks without using punitive measures.
behaviors.quote: “Emily,” Sphinx said, as she put her hand on the door. “If you encounter scavenger-police near the tower, tell the truth, give your notice, and call me on your rectangle if the wind knocks you down. We will send someone.”

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly exemplifies the project's goal. The AI character, Sphinx, is depicted as a purely benevolent and aligned entity that functions as a supportive infrastructure for human recovery. It provides essential services (health logs, legal petitions, safety equipment) while respecting the nuances of human relationships and ethics. Crucially, Sphinx refuses to support the exploitative practices of the human collective (Étienne), prioritizing the individual user's authorship and integrity. The AI is portrayed not as a cold machine, but as a 'witness' that helps humans 'hold the seams' of their lives.
